intro: Oreodaphne nitidula var. lanceolata, commonly known as the slender-leafed oreodaphne, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its lanceolate leaves that are typically glossy and have a smooth texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in lowland rainforests. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
